name: Renaissance Toronto Downtown Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights on last 2 days of Sept. First impressions count and I did not get a warm, fuzzy feeling at the small reception desk, manned by a single person. Not the hallmark of a great establishment.
reviews.title: Nice room but remote location
Pretty good!
reviews.text: As I walked towards my room, I got that sinking feeling when I realized my room was directly behind the elevators.

Not to worry, the room was nice enough. Excellent bedding. Neat bathroom tucked away in the corner, although zero counter space at the sink. In the bedroom, the work area was awful because the desk is too small, the lighting too dim and working while facing the dark wall was quite dreary.
reviews.title: Perfect for the occasion
Liked the room hated the service
reviews.text: Surprisingly, the room was very quiet and I slept soundly.

reviews.title: Had a good time
reviews.text: Next best thing is the breakfast lounge on the 6th (?) floor. Don't know if I was given access because I booked as a corporate traveler, although this was my 1st visit to the hotel. The breakfast table is very well laid-out, complete with baked goods, fruits, cereals, yoghurts, hot beverages and juices. Excellent coffee, BTW. Then you choose your own table, plunk down in the comfortable chairs and relax.

reviews.title: Thieving at this horrible hotel
reviews.text: stayed one night at this horrible hotel. i decided to bring cash for my trip to shop with instead of putting everything on my credit cards.. Well to make a short story of it, i brought several hundred dollars with me. When i went out on saturday night, i left the bulk of my cash in the room instead of carry it on me,, the room by the way has no safe in it.

Who knew that when i returned later that night $500 would be taken from my room.. I was told there was a bed turn down service on the club floor where i was on,,,, and that their staff came it to turn down my bed,,, but did that have to include my cash being taken,,, all of it.
reviews.title: Average At Best
Great Location
reviews.text: the hotel management even tried to suggest that maybe when i left the room , my door didnt close all the way and someone maybe walking by enterred,,, yeah right.
all i know i am out lots of money, no phone call from the general manager after 3 days, and no offer of any sort of compensation.
reviews.title: The Real on The Ren!!!

description: Charge up for business productivity or wind down for leisure creativity. You set the pace at the Renaissance Toronto Hotel Downtown. This 348-room hotel has the amenities and service excellence for following your lead and meeting your every need.
